meanings.definition: To make dark, dim, or gloomy.
meanings.sent1: She murks the room by closing all the curtains.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds murks the sky, blocking out the sun.
meanings.sent3: The magician murks the stage with his mysterious tricks.
meanings.sent4: The sadness in her eyes murks the joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fog murks the path, making it hard to see.

meanings.sent1: The murks of the cave made it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The murks of the forest added to the eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The murks of the basement gave me chills.
meanings.sent4: The murks of his mind clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The murks of the night enveloped everything in shadow.
